Text: Thanks!
thanks for the upload...but how do we open the files
They are just rar or zip files renamed for ease of opening them with a comic book reader. CBR is a rar, CBZ is a zip. If you googled the file extensions you would have found that out.

@ delvis203

Nearly all pirated comics you're going to find online are either cbz files or cbr files.  These are file extensions that are really only used for digital comics.

To open these files, you'll need a digital comics reader (like Malkamar already mentioned).
I would recommend using CDisplay.

You can download it from CNet here:
http://download.cnet.com/CDisplay-Image-Display/3000-18488_4-10162238.html
Thanks =)

does this work on a mac? if it does can you explain how to do it.

@ 2Adeline2 

If you're talking about how you can get the comic book files to work on a mac, you'll just need a comic book reader program that is mac-compatible.
I recommend SimpleComic
http://dancingtortoise.com/simplecomic/
or Jomic
http://jomic.sourceforge.net/
I also hear that the Xee image viewer works rather well as a comic book viewer
http://wakaba.c3.cx/s/apps/xee

If you're asking about how to get torrenting to work on a mac, you'll need a BitTorrent client and it would be best if you just googled around for help with that.
